page.title: 01North of Kirton in Lindsey
page.content: The area is in general bare arable land with thin hedges and few trees. Sloping up gently from the east it drops suddenly away to give wide views over flat farmland to the power stations on the trent. The steep western slope of this "Lincoln Cliff" has a little permanent pasture some good trees and five farmhouses and barns. Fishermen and wild duck use the old cement works clay pits.The works partly demolished is now only a bagging depot through its social club remains. It's limestone quaries remain a feature either side of the busy scunthorpe road along the ridge. To the south small businesses. Potato packing, grain storage, car breaking, plant hire, an agricultural chemicals depot, and a caravan and garden centre are grouped about Kirtons Railway Station (sigle line since 1982).
